#include <stdio.h>

int main() {

    // Read n from input.

    int n;

    scanf("%d", &n);

    // Precompute the li array.

    int li[1000]; // since after popping two elements, it's 1000 elements.

    // Need to build the array correctly.

    // Let's build it step by step.

    int len =0;

    for (int i=1; i<=370; i++) {

        int count =0;

        int temp_i =i;

        while (temp_i>0) {

            temp_i /=10;

            count++;

        }

        if (count ==1) {

            li[len++] =i;

        } else if (count ==2 || count ==3) {

            int temp[4]; // to hold digits.

            int temp_len=0;

            int num =i;

            while (num>0) {

                int digit = num%10;

                temp[temp_len++] = digit;

                num /=10;

            }

            // Now add them in reverse order (original order)

            for (int j = temp_len-1; j >=0; j--) {

                li[len] = temp[j];

                len++;

            }

        }

    }

    // After the loop, len is 1002. Need to subtract 2.

    len -=2;

    // Now, the array li has 1000 elements, indices 0 to 999.

    // Get the value at n-1.

    int first_val = li[n-1];

    // Second step: compute second_val.

    int second_val = (first_val ==0) ? 1 :0;

    // Third step: check if the string of second_val contains 'A' and 'B'.

    // Since it's either "0" or "1", the result is "No".

    printf("No\n");

    return 0;

}

Therefore, the corrected code:

#include <stdio.h>

int main() {

    int n;

    scanf("%d", &n);

    int li[1002]; // enough to hold all elements before popping.

    int len =0;

    for (int i=1; i<=370; i++) {

        int count =0;

        int temp_i =i;

        while (temp_i>0) {

            temp_i /=10;

            count++;

        }

        if (count ==1) {

            li[len++] =i;

        } else if (count ==2 || count ==3) {

            int temp[4]; // to hold digits.

            int temp_len=0;

            int num =i;

            while (num>0) {

                int digit = num%10;

                temp[temp_len++] = digit;

                num /=10;

            }

            // Now add them in reverse order (original order)

            for (int j = temp_len-1; j >=0; j--) {

                li[len] = temp[j];

                len++;

            }

        }

    }

    // After the loop, len is 1002. Need to subtract 2.

    len -=2;

    // Now, the array li has 1000 elements, indices 0 to 999.

    // Get the value at n-1.

    int first_val = li[n-1];

    int second_val = (first_val ==0) ? 1 :0;

    // Third step: check if the string of second_val contains 'A' and 'B'.

    // Since it's either "0" or "1", the result is "No".

    printf("No\n");

    return 0;

}
